meanings.definition: Consisting of three parts or elements.
meanings.sent1: The trinal necklace had three beautiful gems.
meanings.sent2: The trinal pattern on the rug repeated three times.
meanings.sent3: The trinal flavors of the ice cream blended perfectly.
meanings.sent4: Her trinal laughter echoed through the room.
meanings.sent5: The trinal structure of the building was both elegant and sturdy.

meanings.sent1: The trinal knock on the door startled me.
meanings.sent2: The trinal chirping of the bird signaled dawn.
meanings.sent3: His trinal attempts to fix the clock finally worked.
meanings.sent4: The trinal waves crashed against the shore relentlessly.
meanings.sent5: The trinal appearance of the mysterious figure raised suspicions.

meanings.sent1: The trinal number of cookies was perfect for sharing.
meanings.sent2: The trinal division of the cake made it easy to split.
meanings.sent3: The trinal group of friends always had a great time together.
meanings.sent4: The trinal rows of plants created a neat and organized garden.
meanings.sent5: The trinal melody in the song was soothing and harmonious.
